item.title: BitSummit the 13th games lineup announced
item.content:encoded:
Over 120 independent games from Japan and around the world.

The BitSummit Organization Committee has announced the official game selection for BitSummit the 13th, which will run from July 18 to 20 at Miyako Messe Exhibition Center in Kyoto, Japan.

The Kyoto event will feature 120 independent games from Japan and around the world, including Alabaster Dawn from Radical Fish Games, Cassette Boy from Wonderland Kazakiri, The Little Tomb: The Maholova Club and the Search for a Dead Body from CAVYHOUSE, Navinosuke: The YO-KAI Buster from KOHACHI STUDIO, Never’s End form Hypersect, and many more. The full list of games is available here. View the floor map here.

BitSummit the 13th attendees will be able to explore the full official selection, along with additional titles from sponsors and partners featuring upcoming projects, hands-on demos, and exclusive content.

“We were blown away by the sheer volume of outstanding submissions from developers worldwide,” said Japan Independent Games Aggregate co-founder John Davis in a press release. “Choosing this year’s lineup was no easy task, but we couldn’t be more excited to showcase these games. BitSummit is about celebrating indie creativity, championing bold ideas, and bringing this incredible community together to share in that passion.”

BitSummit the 13th will also broadcast from the main stage on both July 19 and 20 on YouTube, Twitch, TikTok, and Bilibili in English, Japanese, and Chinese.

Additional information regarding participating titles, guest speakers, streaming booths, influencers, and sponsors will be announced in the coming weeks.
